Detailed Description

Provides exclusive access to a buffer holding BODY data.

This class manages memory buffers according to a transfer-of-ownership paradigm similar to that of the auto_ptr<> class of the STL. The buffers hold OBEX BODY data which is either transferred from application layer towards the Transport Adapter and stack or vice-versa. Access to the manages buffer is granted only through accessor object instances which must be passed an ObexBuffer instance as constructor parameter. The accessor classes Reader and Writer are available as public inner classes of ObexBuffer.

Destruction of a valid ObexBuffer instance also means destruction of the managed memory buffer which helps to avoid memory leaks. Buffers can be allocated either by the constructor (this will allocate memory using new) or by means of a custom buffer factory, which must be derived from the public inner class Factory. While in the former case the destructor takes care of releasing buffer memory, explicitly allocated memory must be deallocated by the associated factory instance, too. Failure to do so will cause the destructor to trigger an assertion. Therefore, unless forced by special circumstances, one should use the standard way of allocating buffer space using the constructor.

Example: The following code sample demonstrates how copy construction and assignment operations affect ownership of a memory buffer managed by ObexBuffer instances. 

    static void ShowTransferOfOwnerShip()
    {
       // Create a new ObexBuffer instance which manages a buffer of
       //   1024 bytes of memory allocated on the heap.
       ObexBuffer   new_buffer(1024);

       // 'new_buffer' now manages a memory buffer.
       ASSERT(new_buffer.IsValid());

       // Obtain ownership by copy construction
       ObexBuffer   obtain_by_copy( new_buffer );

       // 'new_buffer' does no longer refer to a memory buffer !
       ASSERT( ! new_buffer.IsValid );

       // ... because 'obtain_by_copy' holds it now !
       ASSERT( obtain_by_copy.IsValid() );

       // but now lets transfer the ownership back to 'new_buffer' by assignment
       new_buffer = obtain_by_copy;

       ASSERT( ! obtain_by_copy.IsValid() );
       ASSERT( new_buffer.IsValid() );
       // On return from the function 'new_buffer' is destroyed releasing the
       // buffer allocated by the constructor.
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexBuffer::ObexBuffer (   ) 
 

Constructs an invalid ObexBuffer.

The invalid ObexBuffer can obtain ownership of a data buffer by assigning a valid ObexBuffer object to it.

ObexBuffer::ObexBuffer (  Size  capacity  ) 
 

Constructs an ObexBuffer and allocates memory for it.

At construction time, 'capacity' size bytes of memory are allocated using either new or Os::HugeAlloc() as necessary. On destruction of the ObexBuffer object this memory is automatically freed.

Parameters:
size Capacity of the buffer in bytes.

ObexBuffer::ObexBuffer (  ObexBuffer &  take_from  ) 
 

Copy constructor with transfer of ownership semantics !

Assigning a source buffer to a destination buffer will render the source buffer invalid, i.e. it will no longer refer to the chunk of memory it had owner before. This behaviour is much like the auto_ptr<> of the STL !

ObexBuffer::~ObexBuffer (   ) 
 

Destroys an ObexBuffer object.

If the internal data buffer was allocated by the ObexBuffer class, it is automatically deleted in an appropriate way. Otherwise no action is taken.

Member Function Documentation

ObexBuffer & ObexBuffer::operator= (  ObexBuffer &  take_from  ) 
 

Assignment operator with transfer of ownership semantics !

Assigning a source buffer to a destination buffer will render the source buffer invalid, i.e. it will no longer refer to the chunk of memory it had owner before. This behaviour is much like the auto_ptr<> of the STL !
